Package javelin.model.world.location.unique

Class AdventurersGuild

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.world.Actor
      • javelin.model.world.location.Location
        • javelin.model.world.location.fortification.Fortification
          • javelin.model.world.location.unique.UniqueLocation
            • javelin.model.world.location.unique.AdventurersGuild
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class AdventurersGuild
extends UniqueLocation
    Applies class kits to low-level player units. A kit is usually a set of 3 to 5 upgrades that can be applied randomly to ensure progression up to level challenge rating 2.
    Author:
    alex
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • generategarrison

        protected void generategarrison​(int minlevel,
                                int maxlevel)
        Description copied from class: Fortification
        The default implementation generates a Location.garrison according to the location. Called during construction and responsible for setting Fortification.targetel.
        Overrides:
        generategarrison in class Fortification
        Parameters:
        minlevel - See Fortification.minlevel.
        maxlevel - See Fortification.maxlevel

      • pay

        public static float pay​(int bonus,
                        float days,
                        java.util.List<Combatant> workers)
        Calculates a paycheck that is twice the food cost for a character per day.
        Parameters:
        bonus - Each unit here means an entire dayworth of food bonus to the paycheck per day.
        days - This method does not update Squad.hourselapsed.
        Returns:
        Amount in gold pieces ($).

      • getcombatants

        public java.util.List<Combatant> getcombatants()
        Specified by:
        getcombatants in class Actor
        Returns:
        Any combatants that are situated in this actor, may return null if this is not a valid request for this type of actor. For performance if a List is returned it should be the canonical one, and thus should not be directly modified by the receiver.
        See Also:
        Combatant.newid()
